cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting northward, forecast to turn northeast, cross Florida’s Big Bend Thursday, then accelerate northeast across Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before moving into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Apalachicola/Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Anclote River to the Walton/Bay County line FL; Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Chance (35%) of tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) late Friday into early Saturday; 8% chance of ≥58 mph gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge possible (around 1–2 ft) as the storm passes offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 4–7 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts causing flooding in and around Charleston Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; temporary channel restrictions likely due to heavy rain and gusty winds
